main event: A bright unidentified object was observed over Fort Benning, Georgia on January 12, 1951.
interesting points: The object appeared bright and large, similar in size to an automobile tire., It was initially mistaken for a balloon due to its shape but was at an altitude deemed too high for one., The object was seen by Major Gordon and nine other witnesses., The observation lasted approximately 30 seconds, and the object traveled six times its own length before disappearing., A weather balloon check by authorities revealed no balloons were launched that day.
witness description: Major Gordon from the 111th GIC Detachment and nine civilians
